title: Size proportion between primary/secondary elements in Snygg2
body:
### Feature idea ## Suggestions (`candidate-word`) The **primary** content (emojis, e.g. Chinese characters) and **secondary** content (metadata descriptions, transliterations) are controlled by the same size property. When adjusting the size: - Word suggestions, Emoji and its name text both change size together - Chinese characters and their English transliteration below change size together **In previous snygg version:** - Emoji metadata text was proportionally smaller than the emoji itself - Similar size differentiation existed for Chinese input suggestions **Separate the size controls to allow different sizing for:** - Primary content (word suggestions/emojis, Chinese characters) - Secondary content (metadata descriptions, transliterations) or idk, maybe make secondary content automatically X times smaller then primary. For example, the padding/margin of the `smartbar-candidate-row` needed to be removed to prevent the secondary text from being cropped with desired primary content font-size.
Screenshots

Left: snygg v1, Right: snygg v2


## Tiles Similar behaviour with tiles text vs icon size. Changing the tile font size affects both text and icons equally, making it difficult to achieve ideal visual proportions currenlty
Screenshots

Left: snygg v1, Right: snygg v2


**I just wanted to say a big thank you for all your hard work, time and nervous energy you put into this. Snygg2 unlocks great things, and these are just minor details ‚ù§Ô∏è**

title: Use system default font for hinted symbols, same as HeliBoard
body:
### Feature idea

![Screenshot_20240904-214818_FlorisBoard Beta](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/14f99af5-3b93-498d-9d28-5aeef9edae53)
![Screenshot_20240904-214829_FlorisBoard Beta](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe18070e-8374-4821-a6ba-6bc1013042d0)

title: Enhancements for Theme Engine (Snygg)
body:
I am aware that there are more pressing matters here, but let this suggestion stand for consideration, and perhaps it will be addressed at some point.

Namely, the theme editor you've conceived and created is something truly unique, unlocking creativity, and I thank you all guys for enabling such extensive keyboard personalization.

While creating a Gboard-like UI, I encountered a few things that I couldn't resolve, and it might be useful to add in general:

**1.  Add properties for `padding`, `margin`, `gap`**
- Somewhere, I managed to simulate the gap between elements with `border-width` and `border-color` (like in `action key tails`, `sticky action key`, etc.). However, this doesn't always have the desired impact or doesn't work at all, or the element doesn't support those properties. Besides, using borders for spacing is a bit of a silly solution on its own, I admit ü•≤
   


**2.  Separate the design of `action keys` from `sticky action key`**
- If a sticky key (e.g., micüéôÔ∏è) has a specific design, perhaps someone doesn't want their sticky key to be a mic but incognito or something else, and reordering them using the `Reorder Actions` button, the design remains bland for the mic, and it looks inconsistent when the key with the sticky design is moved to the `action row`. Also, the new key that is now in place of the `sticky action key` does not have the desired sticky design. Huh, if you managed to understand anything of what I said.

![florisboard--sticky-action-key](https://github.com/florisboard/florisboard/assets/44645238/47f89341-2b6f-4184-bb52-16fcf964d74e)
   


**3.  Enable change value of `font-size` in `action keys tail`**
- The `font-size` property exists there, but adding any value doesn't seem to have an impact, or perhaps I'm doing something wrong?
   


**4.  Perhaps implement `font-weight` property?**
   


**5.  Consistent `height`/`padding` in the keyboard footer?**
- I'm not sure what this is related to, but when using a borderless theme, the submit button and space have a smaller height (or padding) than keys `?123`/`ABC` (`-202`/`-201`). While in the theme editor, it looks as it should, but when using the keyboard, somehow the height/padding decreases.

![florisboard--footer-height](https://github.com/florisboard/florisboard/assets/44645238/9bc8b101-a97b-4d7f-8f42-ad0a79f20055)
   


**6.  Separate design for all elements of the num layout.**
- Separate design from keys when the num layout is only displayed because if we want to change the design for characters `+`, `(`, `)`, `-`, `%`, `=`, etc., they will be altered on every layout, and that seems odd. But I understand if this might be complicated to implement/rewrite.

![florisboard--num-layout](https://github.com/florisboard/florisboard/assets/44645238/936ce1ba-61d0-4cef-b242-101ebbd1c80a)
![florisboard--num-character](https://github.com/florisboard/florisboard/assets/44645238/b318e3c0-93c5-4579-9308-c09ff9cd1f2f)

   



There are some more nuances, but I won't overburden you with them now.

title: Add option to share image to florisboard
body:
Most apps do not provide copy image,
![](https://i.imgur.com/IRcBOcj.png)

Even gallery apps and image editors such as simple gallery, aves, pocketpaint, do not have a copy image.
Only bromite does, in my apps list.

However, all apps have share, so we can extend the share to florisboard which in turn copies image to clipboard.

Currently, share mechanism does not have a copy for images themselves:
![](https://i.imgur.com/anblqdz.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/6Fn8u7L.png)

It either shows the image or blank, but no option to copy,

body:
In Turkish; √Ç√¢, √õ√ª and √é√Æ characters are used sometimes. It would be nice if they were in the keyboard when you hold the key, just like how it is in the attachments.

![Screenshot_20220722-004736_GitHub.png](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67051709/180321161-5ed52674-c254-4c81-a060-4aced8889a64.png)
√Ç√¢ in the pop-up menu

![Screenshot_20220722-004724_GitHub.png](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67051709/180321201-2d0dd940-1ffc-4ac8-84ce-f8aa2c86f616.png)

√é√Æ in the pop-up menu

If you are able to add the other characters shown in the pop-up, it would be so great if you could do that! But if you are going to do it, can you please make "ƒ±" as the first suggestion, and "√Æ" as the next to that one, just like how the order is in the screenshots? (the same for √¢, and √ª) Because √º and ƒ± are often used whilst √ª and √Æ are rarely used in Turkish

title: Suggestion: Add Clipboard History in Backup/Restore Data category
body:
![Screenshot_20220708-170228_Pixel Launcher](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70685560/177959047-90e02513-0906-4b94-9c17-810ba4bab7c9.png)
Hi. I've been using your keyboard for several months and I have no issues so far. I like its Backup/Restore feature because it doesn't need to reconfigure everything manually when I want to reinstall or use it to my other devices from scratch.

And I think it would be better if you add Clipboard History as well (text-based clipboard) to be a part of backup/restore checkbox in Advanced settings, like for the Pinned and Other categories if possible. By adding that, we don't need to recopy or readd text everything to clipboard and re-pin what I want in particular order.

Thank you very much for this keyboard development!

title: Smartbar Clipboard entries with url entry
body:
<!--
Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!

Guide to a good feature-request:
‚Ä¢ Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.
‚Ä¢ If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to other, file a new issue for each idea. This makes it easier to implement your proposals.
‚Ä¢ Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
‚Ä¢ If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards have the proposed feature implemented, feel free to post them after your description.
-->
#### I've searched through all proposals and couldn't find anything about it and it doesn't seem to be implemented.
### This features does exist in the samsung keyboard and i switched from it to Florisboard, so this feature directly was on my wishlist. 
Basically the last thing in your clipboard pops up in the smart bar and if the last clip board item contains an url it will be a seperate item in smartbar.

For example this text in Clipboard: 'Look at this https://example.com'
Would look like this:
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32615971/171253798-110d9681-2a14-411d-bb14-d66df23d198f.png)
The first entry is the text in clipboard and the second entry is the url that is inside of the copied text

Having the last clipboard entry in the smartbar would be the first proposal and the second one would be some "smart" url entry

title: Limit clipboard item preview max length
body:
Greetings,
I installed the latest FlorisBoard beta, beta 0.3.15-beta01. While scrolling my clipboard, I noticed that a (fixed) item is displayed entirely, and it takes a really long time to scroll through all of it.

Basically, this item is a list of BitTorrent trackers, nothing out of the ordinary, and the recommended feature I'm suggesting is to limit the maximum length of the preview of the items, or to set a custom character limit (e.g. set custom limit to 150 characters). This would only affect the preview of the items, not the actual clipboard item content.

Image previews for this issue:
![issue_preview_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28765699/161060717-019601c1-a202-4be0-b5eb-e329897abe31.jpg)
![issue_preview_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28765699/161060727-baff3764-0f00-4c53-a675-03c7c837a8b9.jpg)
(it just keeps on going)

title: Key shape should not clip content to allow pop-out hints
body:
#### Short description
Using a theme with circle shaped keys partially cuts off the key hints, which looks bad.

#### Steps to reproduce
1. Open FlorisBoard settings
2. Make sure key hints are enabled
2.1. Tap Keyboard
2.2. Enable hinted number row and/or hinted symbols
3. Create a theme that uses circle-shaped keys
3.1. Go to Design > Manage installed themes > Create theme extension
3.2. Tap on the orange '+'
3.3. Select an existing theme (Floris Day or Night)
3.4. Tap on 'Create'
3.5. Tap on the green 'Edit' under the new theme
3.6. Under variables change 'Common Shape' to 'Circle Shape'
3.7. Tap on 'Apply'
4. Tap on the text field at the bottom saying 'Try out your setup'

Result: Keyboard is open, key hints are partially cut off by the circle shape

#### Environment information
- FlorisBoard Version: 0.3.14
- Install Source: F-Droid
- Device: Google Pixel 3a
- Android: 12L

#### Screenshots
Circle-shaped keys
![Circle](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96789053/160252259-5b318034-eff1-43d3-962e-2ddad67ff5a7.png)
Rectangle-shaped keys
![Rectangle](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96789053/160252261-e60171aa-1ae3-46d0-935a-edeceaf3de29.png)

body:
There are already some auxiliary languages in FlorisBoard, like Esperanto and Interlingua. I'd also like to have the [Interslavic](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interslavic)  layout.

Here's an example of a community-made interslavic layout for gboard:

![IMG_20220311_144056_943](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66178592/157860365-fdcc2a5f-3372-4170-89e5-e8e091388627.jpg)

All of those letters already exist in either russian, ukraininan or serbian layouts, but using three different for one purpose is obvioulsy not a solution.

title: Show native language or custom name on space key
body:
Hi @patrickgold could you please add new algorithm to the KeyboardView to show the languages native name or use a custom LABEL for each languages that available on FlorisBoard like two other keyboard Gboard and Swiftkey has been used for language names instead of system language name for example they used custom label (⁄©Ÿàÿ±ÿØ€å) for my native language Kurdish, But on the Floris does not support using custom labeled for language name is just show the device language name I'm use English for my device it shows as (Central Kurdish) that's a long name of branch the common and standard name is (⁄©Ÿàÿ±ÿØ€å) on the older version 3.13 i used this on language tag (   "languageTag": "⁄©Ÿàÿ±ÿØ€å"  ) also i added this new line (   "languageLabel": "⁄©Ÿàÿ±ÿØ€å"  ) on the config.json file  but by this way doesn't worked on keyboard app is show (null or und) on the space bar instead of (⁄©Ÿàÿ±ÿØ€å), This maybe need to other languages like Spanish or French because native name of them is (Espa√±ol and Fran√ßais) but is shows Spanish and French on the space key and also on the language list.

Please let us use custom label for language names like Gboard and Swiftkey do on there keyboards.

Sorry for my bad English :(

Regards.

body:
<!--
Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!

Guide to a good feature-request:
‚Ä¢ Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.

title: Relocate back-button in clipboard-manager
body:
The reason for this proposal is: for some reason, in this specific scenario, if the user accidentally clicks on the same spot twice
![Screenshot_20211216-110106_GitHub.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/146350501-6c963a9f-1c54-4f2c-82b3-eead25c0974b.jpg)
![Screenshot_20211216-110752_KISS launcher.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/146351704-9f00c2b0-270f-47b0-9c8c-a96e4eeb587e.jpg)
, then all clipboard items will be deleted. This happened to me acouple of times.

The first proposal i thought of was moving the buttons like this:
![Screenshot_20211216-105801_One UI Home.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/146350827-701d7563-aff1-4e82-9370-37d8ea001a31.jpg)
This would align with Florisboard's "press the same area a second time to return"-design (see the navigation when going to symbols, when switching languages, or when toggling the bottom smart-bar, for example)

title: Musical Note Symbol Wrong Category
body: I have used Florisboard for quite a while now and with every update it gets more stable and therefore usable and is my number one choice by now, so thanks for the great work!! üëè I stumbled across a peculiar thijg when I was looking for the musical notes emojis (üéºüéµüé∂). They are in the category with the lightbulb symbol (üí°) on the tab which makes sense to me as all the instruments can also be found in this category. However I was looking for them in the next category, as this category uses four symbols on its tab, one of which is a musical note. Perhaps it would make sense to replace this symbol with a check mark or some other symbol that can actually be found in this category. To illustrate my point here are some screenshots: This issue definitely isn't very impactful, but I thought I'd point it out in case no one else has noticed. Cheers! **Environment information** ‚Ä¢ FlorisBoard Version: 0.3.13 ‚Ä¢ Install Source: F-Droid ‚Ä¢ Android: 11

title: Dynamic color [a.k.a Material You] support
body:
Add an option to theme the keyboard with Android 12's dynamic colors. GBoard already has this feature, but I would rather want to use FlorisBoard. This is optional, but you could also implement Material Design 3 elements too [Pill shapes & circles instead of rounded rectangles].

Here's a screenshot of GBoard's dynamic color theme:
![gboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65370175/139607945-c7f6b2a6-a512-47df-a008-8b52b0f52508.png)

Thanks!

title: Adapt popup-width to key-width
body:
The popup-widths were adapted to the regular keyboard. They don't automatically change their width for other keyboards though.

(See pictures at the end)

1. This isn't optimal
2. On the number keyboard, ALL popups have the wrong width, not just the horizontal ones.
3. From a design-standpoint I'm not sure what is the best course of action. Fat popups aren't optimal, but they seem like the best option we have right now.

title: Add spacing between paste-icon and copied text
body: I think this picture shows my reasoning pretty well: ![20210610_222350.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/121592191-a92acb00-ca3a-11eb-93a2-c7e660f0061a.jpg)

title: Shorten settings-titles
body:
I think it's best if users didn't have to turn their phone sideways, just to know what an option does.

I suggest either
- giving titles line-breaks (the easy solution) or
- working through them in the languages available tp you and thinking on how to name them more efficiently. (probably the more difficult but better solution.

Motivation:

title: Improve Settings: Welcome Screens
body:
I think the welcome-screens should be improved. Here's a few thoughts, formulated in a very curt way:

___
- I don't see any need to add a link to a page that just tells you **again**, that you won't get tracked.
- In general, use way way less text. Maybe also make the important parts bold.
![Screenshot_20210605-064813_FlorisBoard Beta.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/120888096-d28cc680-c5f6-11eb-8743-612111fca201.jpg)

___
Shouldn't be required. Please don't disable "weiter" (or whatever the english word is)

___
Seems like a very unneccessary screen to me.
If you want the user to be notified about "you're done", use a temporary popup. 
![Screenshot_20210605-064855_FlorisBoard Beta.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/120888441-9f4b3700-c5f8-11eb-9337-85a9b76ce633.jpg)

title: Multiple clipboard suggestions when nothing is typed
body:
<!--
- Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
- If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to each
  other, file an issue per idea. This makes it easy to implement one
  feature proposal at a time.
- If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards which
  have the proposed feature implemented, link them here.
- Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.
- Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!
-->

It would be nice to have an option to display the last X clipboard entries (from the clipboard manager) when nothing is typed in the currently selected text input. Similar to the normal scrolling suggestions

For reference:

![GIF](https://www.xda-developers.com/files/2021/04/Gboard-suggestion-bar-GIF.gif)

(taken from https://www.xda-developers.com/gboard-prepares-scrolling-paste-bar-clipboard/)

title: Improve horizontal crash-screen
body:
Not sure whether this should be a feature request or a bug but the horizontal crash-screen is horrible.

1. You can only see one line of code at a time.
2. You can scroll the code, but you can't scroll the screen to somehow improve upon your situation.

I suggest making the screen scrollable **if too few lines of the stacktrace can be displayed**. This would make it so that on phones the horizontal mode is scrollable, while on tablets it stays glued in place (except for the log itself of course.)

![fHorizontalReport](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/115565313-8e996880-a2b9-11eb-84ab-c6c49ed3e57f.jpeg)

title: Add IPA keyboard
body:
<!--
- Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
- If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to each
  other, file an issue per idea. This makes it easy to implement one
  feature proposal at a time.
- If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards which
  have the proposed feature implemented, link them here.
- Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.
- Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!
-->

[International Phonetic Alphabet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Phonetic_Alphabet) (IPA) is a way to represent sounds in languages. As I am often in linguistic discussions, I find it helpful to have a keyboard for it.

I suggest not following Gboard's example, whose layout spreads over four pages with all vowels on the second page and thus unpleasant to use. I have two suggestions for implementation:

- Use QWERTY layout, make the input based on [X-SAMPA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-SAMPA) (sorry I don't have a visual for it)
  - the default key is like normal QWERTY
  - after pressing Shift, each key returns the equivalent IPA symbols encoded by X-SAMPA
    - e.g. `Shift` + `s` ‚Üí x/S/ ‚Üí  É
  - All keys' variants can be accessed by holding the key (e.g. hold s --> show x/S/  É, x/s\/ …ï, x/s`/  Ç)
  - Symbols encoded by non-alphanumeric characters in X-SAMPA (which usually don't represent consonants nor vowels) are in the special character input.
- Use X11 keyboard layout, like in the below picture. In each key:
  - the bottom left is the default key
  - the top left is the key after pressing Shift
  - the other keys can be accessed by holding the key
  - characters that don't look like a letter (which usually don't represent consonants nor vowels) can be put in the special character input.

![X11 layout](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19296926/113422183-78089b80-93f6-11eb-9145-28bbc030ddb3.png)

title: Make icons scale with the text size
body:
<!--
- Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
- If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to each
  other, file an issue per idea. This makes it easy to implement one
  feature proposal at a time.
- If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards which
  have the proposed feature implemented, link them here.
- Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.
- Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!
-->

Hi. I think that it would be good if the icons for backspace/enter follow the same size as the font size multiplier. I currently have my font size set at 90%, but the icons look massive and don't change. By making the icons scale with the rest of the letters would make the keyboard look more consistant and overall better. 

Heres the large icons here:
![Keyboard here with the large icons](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46629504/113147342-96b93780-9228-11eb-8d85-e54bc54b0f1e.jpg)

body:

At least `ABC` and the delete button should follow the keyboard's design by being buttons.

title: Allow selection of font for key labels
body:
I wish there was a way to at least select between Sans-Serif, Monospace and Serif Fonts for the rendering of the Key labels on FlorisKeyboard.

As it stands now, the font used for rendering key labels is hardcoded in [KeyView.kt:101](https://github.com/florisboard/florisboard/blob/1f3221a8865350effc0c54a821243f43acf16cc5/app/src/main/java/dev/patrickgold/florisboard/ime/text/key/KeyView.kt#L101)

I would be happy to see a new setting, for example under Keyboard > Keys > Below the options for font size
allowing one to pick between the Options DEFAULT, MONOSPACE, SANS-SERIF, SERIF as defined in [android.com/reference/android/graphics/Typeface](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/Typeface)

A nice-to-have would be an option to pick between fonts installed on the system, one could use `Typeface.create("Name of font",Typeface.NORMAL)` to create an instance of that typeface.

Image shows FlorisBoard with a custom theme and typeface manually changed to SERIF using `typeface = Typeface.SERIF`
![Screenshot_20210326-230230_Telegram_FOSS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81446174/112697411-c1516c00-8e87-11eb-9715-4ea7199340c2.png)

title: Per Screen Orientation key height and key gaps
body:
<!--
- Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
- If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to each
  other, file an issue per idea. This makes it easy to implement one
  feature proposal at a time.
- If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards which
  have the proposed feature implemented, link them here.
- Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.
- Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!
-->

It'd be great to have some more options for keyboard sizes.

Specifically: allow keyboard height to be changed differently depending on whether the phone is in portrait mode or landscape.

Also maybe allow the gaps between buttons to be disabled, I'd like to use it in landscape mode in an app where I need to have as much as screen view as possible without sacrificing keyboard usability, my current keyboard does it well by letting me change the size in landscape and removing the key gaps so the buttons are easier to click.

Here's a screenshot of some of the options my current keyboard has for inspiration:

![image](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/455058727884554240/810489850230603826/Screenshot_20210214_133142.jpg)

Landscape:

![image](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/455058727884554240/810490188542509066/Screenshot_20210214_134614.jpg)


Thanks.

P.S I love the keyboard so far and it could potentially replace this deprecated keyboard I've been stuck with for so long, just some tiny details that needs to be fixed around.

title: Replace the Cursor-Icon
body:
#### Short description
In the Quick Actions menu, there's this `I`-button that opens up the selection-keyboard.

That icon shouldn't be cursive. A cursive `I` is commonly used as an indicator for _italics_, and this makes it confusing. (Look at LibreOffice or Github and what they use for italics)

![Screenshot_20210204-150848_GitHub.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/106903951-e7b22100-66fa-11eb-852e-83949c1342a4.jpg)

body:

title: Rename Emoji-Button Options.
body:
Thank you for adding the option to disable the emoji-button!

That being said, I think renaming  some of the options would be a good idea.

![Screenshot_20210127-094831_FlorisBoard.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/105989319-3cbdb980-60a1-11eb-8ae8-df605c4b3c85.jpg)


The biggest problem I had was... I didn't quiete understand what those options even meant. So here's some ideas for renaming things:
#### Improvements:
1. Change "Key Switch Mode" to something like "Emoji-button Settings"
**Reason:** This actually tells users what we're changing the options for.
2. Rename the Options to something similar to those:
  - "No Emoji-Button"
  **Reason:** Nobody knows what the so called switch is.
  - "Default (Emoji-Button)"
  **Reason:** The "Switch" bothers me.
This is the standart-option, right? The Default should probably be at the top of the list.
  - I don't think most users understand what internal vs system mean. So if this is how it works, i suggest renaming the two language switch options to something like "Switch Language" and "Switch Keyboard-App"
  - Rename the last option in accordance to what the previous options are called (after renaming them)

title: Long-press improvement
body:
### Issue
**(Assuming the space-bar long-press-action is set to "none / no action")**

When long-pressing on spacebar, nothing happens. Which, in my opinion, is wrong.

**It shouldn't be**

_long press is triggered ‚Üí do nothing_.

**Instead it should be**

_Long press NEVER EVEN GETS ACTIVATED ‚Üí space-bar behaves as if it was short-pressed_.

Meaning, that if there was no swiping going on, when the finger releases the space-bar, input `space`.

I assume, the "insert space" option was intended to do this, but this option is no replacement for a real "long-press disabled" option.
Why? Because "insert space" doesn't insert `space` when releasing the space-bar. It triggers like a regular long-press. Meaning that with this, we'd return to the https://github.com/florisboard/florisboard/issues/88 -problem.

### Request:
Add a switch that lets the user turn off long-presses for the space-bar.

This makes it only input space once released. Just like this button works:
![Screenshot_20210123-080728_GitHub.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/105571652-1a9b0300-5d52-11eb-94f5-fa9bece54298.jpg)

title: Improvement in theming: adapt colour to app
body:
When adapt colour to app opt-in is turned on
There is  lag sometimes when opening an app like signal or WhatsApp
But this doesn't happen when the option is turned off
Also sometimes it switches to other keyboards
 
![Screenshot_20210123-102218284](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75420364/105569276-b0587300-5cfd-11eb-8a68-c9472de767cd.jpg)

There is also some problems adapting keyboard in vlc app while using adapt colour to app option

![Screenshot_20210123-102205791](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75420364/105569309-f44b7800-5cfd-11eb-8d59-e5a32e19cdd6.jpg)

I hope my suggestion is understandable for you 
Thank you very much for developing Florisboard
Version-0.3.4
Android 10
 resurrection Remix os vanilla

title: Brackets (< and >) extended popups
body:
Brackets usually have some extended popups, could you add them to FlorisBoard?
Usually these popup symbols are both in brackets and on other keys (some of these are already on other keys in FlorisBoard but they should also be in brackets).
The symbols are:

- Left bracket (`<`): `‚Äπ`, `‚â§` and `¬´`
![left-bracket](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24703825/105425973-132c0a80-5c29-11eb-962f-cff9d20b6322.jpg)

- Right bracket (`>`): `‚Ä∫`, `‚â•` and `¬ª`
![right-bracket](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24703825/105425018-47063080-5c27-11eb-834e-8b3e96a63fde.jpg)

title: Improve Keyboard-Loading-Screen
body:
**Environment information**
- FlorisBoard Version: v0.3.2
- Install Source: F-Droid
- Device:Samsung Galaxy S9
- Android version: 10

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Unclear
2. Click on something that opens up the keyboard
(For example the browser search-bar)
3. See the selection-keyboard flash for a split second.
Then the proper keyboard opens


I thought I had seen this issue already somewhere, but I couldn't find it, which is why i decided to create a new one.

Also, by "Selection keyboard", I meant this:
![Screenshot_20210118-211429_GitHub.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59611881/104959314-41fc7380-59d2-11eb-811b-d91543be6dc1.jpg)

title: Hide keys border
body:
<!--
- Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
- If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to each
  other, file an issue per idea. This makes it easy to implement one
  feature proposal at a time.
- If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards which
  have the proposed feature implemented, link them here.

-->

I'd like a feature to hide keys border / shadows to make something like in GBoard

title: colemak support
body:
Colemak or other alternative English keyboard layouts would be great I use colemak over QWERTY since it's a lot easier for me to type on theirs also other keyboards like Dvorak halmak and many more I can't think of the top of my head

Here is what colemak looks like in my current keyboard openboard
![Screenshot_20201207-183427](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45698918/101421869-f5922400-38ba-11eb-903e-af09a4c1a5df.png)

title: Reorder keys to avoid tapping navigation pill instead of space.
body:
This is a bit niche request, but I use Navigation Gestures-app and the pill always gets on the way (like in the picture attached). Some keyboards have a function to lift keyboard on the screen (pixelwise) enough to avoid misclicking. More elegant solution would be reordering of  keys, so that bottom corners would have buttons but there would be empty space between them.
![Screenshot_20201202-114018](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/317905/100898183-293f0980-34c9-11eb-9f6a-b632af39298d.png)

title: Emoji suggestion
body:
### Feature description:
The user should get a suggestion of emojis after typing a special character followed by a word that matches the emoji he wants suggested.
### Example:
User types `:cat`
The suggestion bar shows üò∫üò∏üòπüòªüêà...etc

Here are three screenshots as an example:
The first screenshot is taken from the Element app, it uses many keywords for each emoji.
![Screenshot_20201201-224607783 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12894695/100801749-b41bf780-3428-11eb-91c5-a93cd347d435.jpg)

The second screenshot is taken from the Discord app, it uses a single word or a sequence separated by `-` as a keyword for each emoji.
![Screenshot_20201201-225412880 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12894695/100801790-c26a1380-3428-11eb-9415-6e0095d4115f.jpg)

The third screenshot is taken while using AnySoftKeyboard.
![Screenshot_20201201-230918703](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12894695/100802979-9d76a000-342a-11eb-969c-7e9913b8dbcd.jpg)

title: Adjusting keyboard height should also increase size of Symbols
body:
<!--
- Describe your idea in a short but concise way.
- If you have multiple ideas which are not directly connected to each
  other, file an issue per idea. This makes it easy to implement one
  feature proposal at a time.
- If you have any examples, e.g. screenshots or other keyboards which
  have the proposed feature implemented, link them here.
- Please search existing proposals to avoid creating duplicates.
- Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!
-->
Thanks again for your nice work.  It looks, that adjusting keyboard height only affects the surrounding button size. I'll suggest that it should increase the font size of the symbols as well. 

Thank you!


Edit:  Seeing another screenshots, maybe it's  bug on my device?

**Environment information**

FlorisBoard Version: 0.2.2
Install Source: izzy f-droid
Device: OnePlus 6
Android version, ROM: OmniRom android 10

**Steps to reproduce**

Changing Keyboard height in Settings doesn't affect the font size of symbols.

Screenshots  are showing  extra short and extra tall

![Screenshot_Noteless_20201031-112350](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53949193/97776818-b2ca8700-1b6b-11eb-8ede-ab17c46ae6e6.png)
![Screenshot_Noteless_20201031-112311](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53949193/97776819-b3fbb400-1b6b-11eb-9031-891aaae6471a.png)
milestone_description: Improvement of key font size / keyboard height algorithm; Feature improvements; Lots and lots of bug fixing

title: Increase the size of numeric keys in number row
body:
<!--
- Describe the bug in a short but concise way.
- If you have a screenshot or screen recording of the bug, link them at
  the end of this issue.
- Please search existing bug reports to avoid creating duplicates.
- Thank you for your help in making FlorisBoard better!
-->
The numaric keys in number row are too small and are hard to use so make them big as there is more space so it can be utilized more efficiently.

**Environment information**
- FlorisBoard Version: <!-- e.g. 0.1.0 --> 0.2.2
- Install Source: <!-- Google PlayStore/F-Droid/GitHub/? --> izzy f-droid
- Device: <!-- e.g. OnePlus 7T --> huawei y9s
- Android version, ROM: <!-- e.g. 10, Stock --> android 10

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Enable number row.
2. Click on a input field to open keyboard.
3. See issue.
